As an AI language model, I cannot provide an opinion, but funding and support for microbiology research is critical to advancing knowledge and developing new solutions for the pressing issues facing researchers in this field. The level of funding and support for microbiology research varies across countries and organizations, but it is generally agreed that more funding and support are needed to address these issues. 

Government agencies, private foundations, and other funding agencies provide financial support for microbiology research, but competition for funding can be intense, and some areas of research may receive more funding than others. Additionally, in recent years, factors such as political and economic instability, declining public trust in science, and changing priorities for research funding have affected the resources available for research in microbiology and other fields.

Investments in funding and support for microbiology research have the potential to drive scientific discoveries, stimulate innovation, and promote advancements in medicine, public health, agriculture, and other fields that can benefit society.
